sections.title: 2. App Description
content: Sport Track Merger is a mobile app for Android and iOS, designed for Strava users who want to merge or duplicate their activities. It allows you to merge or duplicate your existing Strava activities and send the new one directly to your account.
The app notably enables:
- Merging consecutive activities in time, for example in case of interruption or segmentation of an outing due to a GPS or technical error
- Merging temporally overlapping activities, such as an activity containing GPS data with another containing complementary data like heart rate, power, cadence, or altitude
- Duplicating activities with possible date and time modification
- Directly generating a new merged or duplicated activity on Strava
- Supporting outdoor and indoor activities in the context of merging or duplicating operations
- For Pro version users: full editing of the new activity's data (title, description, activity type, device used, and movement status)
The app is available in French, English, and may be translated into other languages in the future based on user needs.

sections.title: 3. Access and Use Conditions
content: Access to the app requires an active Strava account. Upon first use, the user is prompted to authorize access to their Strava data via the official authentication system.
Data accessed may include: Strava ID, public activities, and associated metrics (distance, duration, altitude, heart rate, power, GPS track, etc.).
The app cannot be used without valid Strava account authorization. Users can revoke this access at any time via the dedicated page on Strava: https://www.strava.com/settings/apps

sections.title: 4. Pro Version Access Terms
content: The app uses a freemium model. All purchases are processed via the official Google Play and Apple App Store platforms, which handle billing and any refund requests according to their own terms:
Free version:
- Merge limited to 2 activities
- Maximum 2 merges per day
- No customization of the new activity (title, description, type, etc.)
Pro version (one-time purchase):
- Unlimited merges
- Full editing of the created activity's fields (title, description, etc.)
- Access to all advanced features
- Priority user support
The Pro version is linked to the user and is therefore accessible on any device (Android or iOS) where the user is logged in with the same account.
A one-month free trial is offered before any final purchase.

sections.title: 2. Data Collected and Purposes
content: The Sport Track Merger app does not collect any personally identifiable data from the user.

Data from the Strava API (public or private activities, metrics, user ID) is only stored locally on the user's phone to enable merging or duplicating activities. None of this data is sent to a third-party server or retained by the publisher.
Merged or duplicated activities are created locally, then sent directly to Strava. Generated files are automatically deleted from the device after sending.
Anonymous data collected:
- Errors and crashes (via Firebase Crashlytics): automatic collection, cannot be disabled
- User actions and performance (via Firebase Analytics & Performance): can be enabled/disabled in the app settings
- Hashed Strava ID (irreversible), used to associate a Pro license with a user account
Secure authentication to Strava is managed via a Firebase Cloud Function to protect the app's API keys. No personal data is processed there.

sections.title: 3. Legal Basis for Processing
content: Processing carried out in the app is based on:
- The contract binding the user to the app for access to Strava features
- The user's consent for usage tracking (Firebase Analytics), which can be enabled or disabled in the settings

sections.title: 4. Data Retention
content: The publisher does not retain any personal data on its own servers. Only anonymous technical data (crashes, performance, usage) is stored on Firebase servers, according to their retention policies.
Activity files are generated locally and automatically deleted after use.

sections.title: 5. Distribution Platforms
content: Sport Track Merger is distributed via the Google Play Store (Google Ireland Ltd.) and the Apple App Store (Apple Inc.). These platforms may collect certain usage and diagnostic data related to the installation, use, or performance of the app.

This data is collected by Google or Apple for analysis purposes, based on the user's consent given in their device settings. The publisher only has access to anonymous and aggregated information, with no personal identification.
For more information:
- Google Play – Privacy settings: https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/3118621
- Apple – Privacy and settings: https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT202100

sections.title: 6. Third-Party Providers and Transfers Outside the EU
content: The app uses the following services:
- Firebase (Google) for technical data collection
- RevenueCat for In-App purchase management
These providers may process some data outside the European Union. They have standard contractual clauses and compliance measures with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

sections.title: 7. User Rights
content: In accordance with the GDPR, the user has the following rights:
- Access, rectification, and deletion of local data by uninstalling the app or logging out of their account
- Ability to revoke Strava access via https://www.strava.com/settings/apps
- Right to object to analytics collection via the app settings
- Right to contact the controller at: b.vic.dev@gmail.com

sections.title: 8. Target Audience
content: The app is reserved for users eligible for a Strava account, i.e., persons at least 13 years old or the minimum required age in their country of residence.

sections.title: 9. Policy Updates
content: This privacy policy may be changed at any time. Any updated version will be published on the app's dedicated page or the official website. Users are encouraged to review it regularly.
